Author: AZDIN
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: To cut through some of the confusion surrounding bitcoin, we need to separate it into two components. On the one hand, you have bitcoin-the-token, a snippet of code that represents ownership of a digital concept ‚Äì sort of like a virtual IOU. On the other hand, you have bitcoin-the-protocol, a distributed network that maintains a ledger of balances of bitcoin-the-token. Both are referred to as "bitcoin."  The system enables payments to be sent between users without passing through a central authority, such as a bank or payment gateway. It is created and held electronically. Bitcoins aren't printed, like dollars or euros ‚Äì they're produced by computers all around the world, using free software.  It was the first example of what we today call cryptocurrencies, a growing asset class that shares some characteristics of traditional currencies, with verification based on cryptography

Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: Sociall is a new social media platform that prides on keeping its user data private. As a decentralized service, it encrypts all user data and stores it all over the world. The data is the property of the user who uploaded it and no one can access it, without his or her permission.  The CEO and owner of Sociall, Jade Mulholland describes the service‚Äôs aim as to provide an adequate response and solution to recent challenges affecting social networks.  Another feature of Sociall is that users are not searchable by external engines. This ensures that only the platform and user approved people can view another user‚Äôs profile and uploaded content.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/sociall-blockchain-social-media-platform-to-end-all-others/

Author: Transformers
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: Buy-Back Program Details  Hello all. As some of you may be aware, SCL is being listed on HitBTC this week! The exact date and time is yet to be confirmed, although we have been told it will be sometime on Wednesday or Thursday.  Below are answers to the many questions that have been asked lately regarding the program.  What is the buy-back program?  The buy-back program is our way of acquiring SCL. Instead of allocating X amount of SCL to the team during the ICO period, we decided to run a buy-back program on the exchange. This way, SCL will be purchased with BTC instead of being allocated free of charge to team members. A total of 5% of SCL will be purchased back once SCL is listed on HitBTC.  How much is spent on the buy-back?  In a previous post here, we stated that we may have to reduce our position of 5% if the price of SCL rises dramatically. We planned on $800,000, although that was when the price of ETH was very different from now. We have allocated 2500 ETH to this program‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand of course, it needs to be exchanged for BTC since the listing is SCL/BTC. That means that the buy-back program will run until we purchase 5% of the circulating supply (being approximately 835,700 SCL) or until we spend all 2500 ETH (in BTC equivalent).  What is the buy-back trading pair?  The trading pair will be SCL/BTC as that will be the only trading pair for SCL at HitBTC. We may eventually get both ETH and USDT trading pairs added in the near future.  What is the estimated price that SCL will reach during this period?  We‚Äôre unable to make any kind of price indications as it is illegal to do so in the country that we operate in.  How long will the buy-back program go for?  We‚Äôre unable to make estimations for the length of the program. It could finish on the first day, it could take multiple days, or it could take multiple weeks. It all depends on how much SCL is being sold within this timeframe.  What if 5% of SCL is not sold during this period?  As per the question above, the buy-back program will run until we either spend 2500 ETH (being approximately 120 BTC) or purchase 5% of circulating SCL. Therefore, the program may potentially run for days if not enough SCL is being sold, or it could run for just a few hours if holders decide to rush to the exchange and sell.  Will the buy-back happen instantly once listed at HitBTC?  The buy-back will be launched quite quickly once listed‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääalthough could happen as far as 24 hours from listing. HitBTC is located in a completed different timezone from us, so listing could happen as we are asleep. Announcements will be made via Twitter and Telegram once it has begun.  How will it work exactly? What will you do?  Quite simple actually‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwe will be setting multiple buy walls at different prices going upwards periodically. Once the buy-wall at a price is completed, we‚Äôll move it up. For example (and only for example, the following prices/numbers are not real), we will set a buy wall of 10 BTC at the price of $0.40. Once the buy wall is complete, we‚Äôll create a new wall of 10 BTC at the price of $0.45. The price will constantly be moving up for each wall that we create until the program is complete.  What will you do with your SCL holdings after the buy-back?  We will have a new announcement after the buy-back program about what we will be doing with our SCL holdings. Long story short for now, we will be locking them away until further developments of the platform.  Keep an eye on our Twitter during the buy-back as all updates will be posted there in real time.  As always, if you happen to have any questions regarding this post, please email us at support@nexus.social, or join us on Telegram.

Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: "Previously most voted for the buyback at cryptopia and Yobit" - Sorry, but that is very inaccurate. We have only ever hosted one poll for the buy-back program.  The first poll we had was to vote for exchange listing preferences. Once we knew the results of this, us as a company decided to host the buy-back at YoBit and Cryptopia. Many members of the community were angry regarding this since myself and many other members of the support team stated that the buy-back would only be hosted at a major exchange.  Their arguments were justified since we basically changed the rules of the buy-back without first consulting the community and ICO contributors first. That is why we decided to host another public poll regarding the preferences of the buy-back program. The community voted against our decision to host the buy-back at the minor exchange - so instead we will wait until being listed on a major exchange and host it there.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: People will migrate if it's easy to do so - and we have solutions for that. We're not ready to publicly state these features yet as they're still being looked over by our legal team. We'll have more news on this in the coming weeks hopefully.  SteemIt is a decentralized near replica of Medium, and it has hundreds of thousands of users. People want a decentralized/distributed future, and that's what we're giving them.  Once version two is released in the coming months, SCL can be spent as fiat via our instant access debit card, used to purchase ad spaces in the integrated ad platform, even used to buy goods and services from other members, plus much more. SCL has many use cases and will have even more in the near future. At least we have a working prototype, unlike many other ICOs going around.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: As per your other examples, SCL can be spent as fiat with the instant access debit card, or used to purchase goods and services from other members of the platform in the marketplace.  Keep in mind that SCL can be divisible to up to 8 decimal places. This allows room for huge price growth if only 16million SCL is in circulation. BTC has a little more than 16million in circulation for example, with a capped supply of 21million. We've hit more than 16million SCL sold, with still more than 3.5 days remaining in the ICO.

Body: Hello Social,  I have been reading the whitepaper, looked at the roadmap and saw and watched the introduction video and allot of questions come to mind.  In the whitepaper there's only the mention of the market that is social media and Online purchases. There's no sight of which major company hold market shares. (Amazon,facebook to mention two.) Why would I go from twitter to Nexus? etc etc. Twitter,ebay,facebook,amazon are unique and set themselves apart hence why people use so much social media cause they have differentiated themselves from others. I go to Pinit to for recipes, I go to facebook for chatting with friends, catching up, see what's new. I go to instagram for well whatever people do there... Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: Hello MoonIsBlue,  My name is Jade and I'm the founder and lead developer of this project. Thanks for reaching out with your concerns. More than happy to address any questions regarding our project.  On page 5 of the white paper, we state the growth of both social networking and digital commerce. It shows that the amount of users social networking world wide is expected to grow far beyond 3billion by 2021. We also state that the amount of people purchasing any kind of good or service online will expand to more than 2.1billion in 2021, being a $2trillion dollar industry.  Our platform is very unique, and as you can see from the other posts here from other BitcoinTalk members, they think so too. Just some of the new features include the instant access debit card, Tor and VPN integration, and multi-wallet with ShareShift built in. It also needs to be understood that Nexus will be a social network for the people. Moderator priviledges will give the power back to reputable members of the platform, therefore keeping it safe. These members will be paid in SCL for their services.  Nothing will be developed in the future without the feedback of the community first. We're not just going to make executive decisions on what we "think" the people will want. Instead, we'll turn to the community and hold Q&As for what they want us to integrate next. We will also be open source, and therefore allowing third party developers to submit pull requests on Github for changes that they'd like to see. So really, we're putting the users first - so I think you're incorrect in stating that we haven't thought about them.  We state on both the ICO website and in the white paper that we will be marketing the platform to raise awareness and gain new members after the new version is released. We will be performing both tradition marketing, along with approaching influences in the space.  We have many plans in the near future for aquiring new users. Many of which we are not ready to announce to the public yet as we're still getting it looked over by our lawyers to make sure everything is above board.  Why wouldn't they want to come to Nexus if they can spend almost any cryptographic based token as real world fiat currency? Why wouldn't they want their data encrypted and stored securely? Why wouldn't they want crowdfunding and marketplace features built right into the same network they use day by day? Why wouldn't they want their messages encrypted end-to-end? Why wouldn't they want all the other benefits of the platform?  The amount of overwhelming postitive feedback we have recieved has been great. People love our platform, and they want to see it succeed as they feel there is a real world use for Nexus, as per the above points. We're not saying that we're going to replace Facebook or Twitter or any other mainstream social network for that matter - we're saying that it can coexist - just like SteemIt is not replacing blogging websites, it can coexist with Medium.  I do understand where you're coming from, but the team and I do believe that our website and white paper shows solid plans and direction for the present and future of our platform.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: No data or multimedia will be stored on centralized servers.  We will be utilizing already existing reputable blockchain applications to store all multimedia uploads and data. Therefore, everything that you upload on Nexus will be dencentralized.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: Hello Peter,  Thanks for the support!  I dedicate a lot of time to both Slack and Telegram as I believe people want their questions answered directly by the founder and lead developer of the project.  We have had a lot of contributions so far, with much more expected over the next 25+ days.  We do have plans to implement a "profit sharing" model soon. More details will be released over the coming weeks. We decided to leave this out of our white paper and website as we still do not have the details finalized. Keep an eye on our social channels for updates on this.  Yes, our buy-back program means that we'll be purchasing back 5% of all SCL when it hits the exchange. We believe in our coin, and we know that it will benefit from the development of our platform, Nexus. The buy-back program should also help SCL enter a bullish trend when it goes live on the exchange.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: No new coins will ever be distributed after the ICO is complete.  For example, if the ICO finishes on the 17th of September with 40million SCL sold, that will be the only amount of SCL in circulation. The hard cap of 50million is to stop a huge supply being released during the ICO.  There will not be another ICO for SCL, ever.

Author: zilions
Title: [ANN] Sociall - a secure and private decentralised social network for all
Body: Photo albums will be added to stage 2.1 of the platform. We're currently in version 1.2.1. Version 2.0 is in development now and should be released early next year. 2.1 will follow just a few months later.
